speaker: SCULLY
line: I feel time like a heartbeat, the seconds pumping in my breast like a reckoning. The luminous mysteries that once seemed so distant and unreal, threatening clarity in the presence of a truth entertained not in youth, but only in it's passage. I feel these words as if their meaning were weight being lifted from me, knowing that you will read them and share my burden, as I have come to trust no other. That you should know my heart, look into it, finding there the memory and experience that belong to you, that are you, is a comfort to me now as I feel the tethers loose and the prospects darken for the continuance of a journey that began not so long ago, and which began again with a faith shakened and strengthened by your convictions, if not for which I might never have been so strong now. As I cross to face you and look at you incomplete, hoping that you will forgive me for not making the rest of the journey with you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oncology? Thanks.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? I uh, stole these from some guy with a broken leg down the hall. He uh, won't be able to catch me. How ya doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess that's the question. Actually I feel fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: What uh, what exactly are we looking at here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's what's called nasopharengeal mass. It's a small growth between the superior conchea and the sinoidal sinus.

speaker: MULDER
line: A growth?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A tumor. You're the only one I've called.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it operable?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: But it's treatable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The truth is that the type and placement of the tumor make it difficult, to the extreme.

speaker: MULDER
line: I refuse to believe that, I..

speaker: SCULLY
line: For all times I have said that to you I am as certain of this as you have ever been. I have cancer. It is a mass on the wall between my sinus and cerebrum. If it pushes into my brain statistically there is about zero chance of survival.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't accept that. Th..there must be some people who have received treatment for this, we..can....

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes there are.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This news comes as the worst kind of surprise Agent Scully. I'm sorry, very sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you sir. I don't mean for this to be awkward and I would appreciate if we could keep this matter confidential.

speaker: MULDER
line: I understand. I assume you'll be taking a leave of absence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No sir, actually I've asked my doctors to hold onto my medical records until Agent Mulder and I can exhaust a possible avenue of investigation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Investigation?

speaker: MULDER
line: Last year agent Scully and I pursued a case in which a number of women, proported abductees, experienced similar symptoms after having implants removed from the base of their necks. A woman in Allentown, Pennsylvania, named Betsy Higopian was undergoing treatment for nasopharengeal tumor. We just haven't been able to contact her yet.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm sure you're aware we have contacts with the best physicians and medical facilities in the country.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes sir, but for my own reasons I'd like to like to pursue this through the justice department rather than a personal matter.

speaker: RELATOR
line: I'm sorry, no early birds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're not here for the garage sale. We're looking for Betsy Higopian. No one's returning our messages.

speaker: RELATOR
line: Sorry, um, Betsy's passed away, just 2 and a half weeks ago. Are you a relation?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, we're with the FBI.

speaker: RELATOR
line: Some kind of trouble?

speaker: MULDER
line: Betsy was part of a MUFON group?

speaker: RELATOR
line: I don't know, I'm just the relator.

speaker: MULDER
line: Would mind if we come inside and take a look?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey Scully listen to this. There's two lines coming into this house. This one was lit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Someone's sending a fax or computer modem.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ya but who and for what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Someone must have remote access to the system.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And downloading data.

speaker: MULDER
line: Copying files. Let's get a trace on this before whoever it is hangs up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Apartment 234 is listed under Kurt Crawford.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to check around back. Why don't you see if you can get the manager.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop! Federal agent! Hold it! Put your hands where we can see them. Is your name Kurt Crawford?

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully..

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm fine Mulder, quit staring at me I'm fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: You ok in there Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ya I'm just washing up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You took his cuffs off.

speaker: MULDER
line: He says he's a member of the same Mutual UFO Network group that Betsy Higopian belonged to, that he was downloading files for safe keeping as Betsy had instructed him to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then why did he run?

speaker: MULDER
line: He thinks his life's in danger, he thinks there's a government conspiracy to suppress the information gathered in those files.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think he's credible?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well he seems to know an awful lot about Betsy and the other women in the MUFON group you met in his house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that will have to be cross-checked.

speaker: MULDER
line: We can't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why not?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did they die?

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: Brain cancer. All within the last year.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All of them?

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: From the group you met there's only Penny Northern, and she's in the hospital and it doesn't look good.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What makes you think this is a conspiracy, that the government's involved?

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: What makes you think it isn't. Eleven women are abducted, all with similar recollections of the experience, all developing identical brain tumors, and all refuse state or federal health care because of their insistence of the facts. And all dying within the space of a year.

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to listen to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: About what?

speaker: MULDER
line: About what you won't to admit to yourself, what you're denying.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What am I denying?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where your cancer came from.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder it doesn't matter.

speaker: MULDER
line: It does matter, if what you have is a result of your abduction and that abduction is something the government knows about then those are facts that should be brought to light.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know what happened to me. I have no clear recollection and I don't think these abductions are even abductions.

speaker: MULDER
line: But these women are dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No they are not. One woman isn't. There's Penny Northern.

speaker: MULDER
line: If you won't listen to me then I think you should go talk to her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: About what? What it feels like to be dying of cancer? What it's like to know that there's absolutely nothing you can do about it?

speaker: MULDER
line: If that's too hard for you then I think you should call an investigator. You have one remaining witness Agent Scully. I'd think you'd want to know what her story is.

speaker: PENNY
line: Dana, hello.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm..I'm sorry did someone tell you I was coming here to see you?

speaker: PENNY
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then how did you know it was me?

speaker: PENNY
line: I recognized you. I told you when we met last year, I held you and comforted you in the place, after the tests.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry I don't mean to be insensitive, but uh, I don't share those memories.

speaker: PENNY
line: It's alight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've come to ask you some questions.

speaker: PENNY
line: About Dr. Scanlon?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Who's Dr. Scanlon?

speaker: PENNY
line: He's treating the cancer. He treated Betsy too. He thinks he might have isolated the cause, and if he'd caught it earlier he might have been able to do more for her, and for me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: His name's Scanlon?

speaker: PENNY
line: Yes. What did you want to ask me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm at the hospital with Penny Northern. Where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm at Betsy Higopian's going through some of those hard files before stuff starts disappearing, and call me an early bird but I think I've found something. Now some of these women who have died, they're childless, and they've been treated for infertility at the clinic about 30 miles from here. Penny Northern and Betsy Higopian are among them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder that's..

speaker: MULDER
line: I've made some phone calls and I've tried to get some information but nobody is talking to me, so..

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder I need you to come up here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why, did you find something there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need you to bring the overnight bag from the trunk of the car and I need you to call my mother and ask her to bring up some things at the hospital.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there something I should know?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, whatever you found or whatever you might find I think that we both know that right now the truth is in me, and that's where I need to pursue it, as soon as possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: I will be right there.

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: Agent Mulder? Agent Mulder?

speaker: DOCTOR SCANLON
line: Dana? I'm Dr. Scanlon. We spoke last night on the phone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ya hi, sorry sleeping.

speaker: DOCTOR SCANLON
line: I noticed. How's your energy level generally?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh you know. I don, I don't feel sick at all.

speaker: DOCTOR SCANLON
line: Your MRI's and your charts aren't here yet but I have an idea of what to expect, you probably do too from your medical training.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know that the chemotherapy is going to make me sick.

speaker: DOCTOR SCANLON
line: And the radiation. They're both part of a high dose approach to knock your system down so we can attempt the gene therapy on P53. You're going to feel like dying.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Dana

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi mom.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is uh, this is Dr. Scanlon.

speaker: DOCTOR SCANLON
line: Hi.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Hi. I uh, I drove. I was going to take the shuttle but it's only an hour more by car. Can you imagine?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mom, I'm fine. I'm going to be fine, I'm just here for treatment

speaker: DOCTOR SCANLON
line: I'm gonna go. I've ordered some additional blood work and I'd like to start in this afternoon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. Mom, I know what you're gonna say, but I don't have any experience being sick. I promise you, I feel fine, I feel..

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: I don't know why you didn't tell me. I don't know why you didn't tell me immediately.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I wanted to get all the answers first.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: And you found them here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have found some clarity, and maybe a way to fight back.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: I don't wanna be kept in the dark.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You'll know mom.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: You have always been the strong one, but you are my only daughter now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know mom.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Oh, Dana.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In med school I learned that cancer arrives in the body unannounced, a dark stranger who takes up residence, turning it's new home against itself. This is the evil of cancer, that is starts as an invader, but soon becomes one with the invaded, forcing you to destroy it, but only at the risk of destroying yourself. It is science's demon possession. My treatment, science has attempted exorcism. Mulder I hope that in these terms you might know it and know me, and accept this stranger that so many recognize but cannot ever completely cast out. And if the darkness should have swallowed me as you read this, you must never think there was the possibility of some secret intervention, something you might have done. And though we've traveled far together, this last distance must necessarily be traveled alone.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've got a gun pointed at your head. Turn around very slowly. Kurt Crawford, we seem to be traveling in the same circles these days.

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: You can put the gun away.

speaker: MULDER
line: You disappeared with those files from Betsy Hagopian's, I called you at least half a dozen times. I got to thinking you're a liar, now tell me I'm wrong.

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: I'm looking for the same that thing you are. I've been trying to hack my way into that system but I can't seem to make it past the password protect.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think you can get access from here?

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: I need to find that password.

speaker: MULDER
line: Vegreville.

speaker: KURT CRAWFORD
line: We're in.

speaker: PENNY
line: Dana, it's ok, it's ok Dana, you'll be ok.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where am I?

speaker: PENNY
line: You're in you're own bed now Dana, you're safe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I feel nauseous.

speaker: PENNY
line: It's the chemo. The chemo's always the worst.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I had a bad dream. Some..someone was doing something bad to me. You were there. I heard your voice.

speaker: PENNY
line: They let me come to you during the procedures. I don't know why, human compassion is not something that they have.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry Penny. I ca..can't hear this right now.

speaker: PENNY
line: You've got to try to make sense of it Dana. It will help you through the pain to understand why this is..this is happening to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need you to set up a meeting for me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Hold up my calls.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where's Agent Scully?

speaker: MULDER
line: She's at a hospital in Allentown beginning treatment.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What happened to your investigative avenues?

speaker: MULDER
line: They've taken a turn. A pretty big U-turn by the looks of it. This is a file directory from a federally operated fertility clinic. Agent Scully's name is on this file, although I'm pretty sure, pretty damn sure she's never undergone treatment for infertility.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What's in the file?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. It's just a directory for a mainframe housed in the Lumbard Research Facility.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So you want to set a meeting, with whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: Cigarette man. I have no doubt in my mind he's behind this.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You've come to me before like this Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ya well this is different, this is different, I'm willing to deal now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Find another way.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no I need that meeting.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You deal with this man, you offer him anything and he will own you forever.

speaker: MULDER
line: He knows what they did to Agent Scully. He may very well know how to save her.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If he knows, you can know too but you can't ask the truth of a man who trades in lies. I won't let you.

speaker: MULDER
line: We are talking about Agent Scully's life.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Find another way.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The Lumbard system is a dedicated mainframe. Impossible to hack, so they say.

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd you guys get in?

speaker: BYERS
line: A modified clipper chip we cannibalized from a government surplus army field encoder.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Bought it back from the Chinese.

speaker: LANGLY
line: But for all the work it took to get it, what we got on Agent Scully's file..I don't know how much help it's gonna be.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: BYERS
line: It's a gene code we've seen before, detected in Scully's blood after her abduction.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does it tell us anything at all?

speaker: BYERS
line: Normal DNA is inactive in it's utical form. When it's unwound or branched like this one that's when it's active, when it can mutate.

speaker: LANGLY
line: It's probably what made her sick.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why store something like this and why keep it a secret?

speaker: BYERS
line: Scientists get funky about having their research poached.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Someone might be trying to find a cause.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or a cure.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Theoretically.

speaker: MULDER
line: You guys ever been to the Lumbard Research Facility? Well pick out something black and sexy and prepare to do some funky poaching.

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: It's funny, I always thought of you as Fox Mulder's patron. You'd think under your eges that he wouldn't be consigned to a corner of the basement.

speaker: SKINNER
line: At least he doesn't take an elevator up to get to work.

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: You think I'm the devil Mr. Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not here to talk about what I think about you.

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: Then why are you here? Is Mulder's partner under illness? Is it terminal, the cancer?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You tell me.

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: Modern medicine today, I hear they can perform miracles.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I need a miracle.

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: Well, you think a lot more of me than you let on Mr. Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What would it take?

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: For Agent Scully's life? What would you offer?

speaker: SKINNER
line: What'll it take?

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: Well, I'll have to get back to you on that. Oh Mr. Skinner, which way is the elevator?

speaker: BYERS
line: We'll double back in 50 seconds. Frohike, where are you guys?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We're in the K section in a storm drain where the communication system links up to public power. Standby. Two minutes for a system check.

speaker: MULDER
line: We gots to go.

speaker: BYERS
line: We're in motion.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: They're in.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Security cameras offline, patching in now.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Smile Byers you're on candid camera.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Exterior security has been breached.

speaker: BYERS
line: Langly are you reading this?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Redundant systems, triple shut bypass this is going to be a toughy.

speaker: MULDER
line: You guys couldn't spring for 2 of these? Langly what the hell is going on?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Mulder. This is going to take a moment.

speaker: MULDER
line: Boys we have a problem. The doctor that's treating Scully's cancer's on staff here.

speaker: LANGLY
line: More mysteries await. Bypass is complete.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look I need someone to get to Scully to get her to stop treatment. Right now you're the only one who can do that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have not written to you in the last 24 hours because the treatment has weakened my spirit as well as my body. Mulder, it's difficult to describe to you the fear of facing and enemy which I can neither conquer nor escape. Penny Northern has taken a downturn. I now look at her with a respect that can only come from one who is about to walk the same dark path. Seeing her I can't help but see myself in a month or a year. I pray that I have her courage to face this journey. Mulder, I feel you close though I know you are now pursuing your own path. For that I am grateful, more than I could ever express. I need to know you're out there if I am ever to see through this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Langly where the hell am I going?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Loosing you on the video feed Mulder. Mulder? Do anything Frohike?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Nada I didn't touch a thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Langly can you hear me? Langley I can't hear you. Open the door. Open the damn door!

speaker: HYBRID
line: Agent Mulder, come in.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're hybrids.

speaker: HYBRID
line: Please come in so that we might explain.

speaker: MULDER
line: You've been using me.

speaker: HYBRID
line: Not at all. You're arrival was only coincident with the execution of our objective.

speaker: MULDER
line: What objective?

speaker: HYBRID
line: Subvert the project. The project that created us.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've seen this boy before. These boys were you.

speaker: HYBRID
line: We're among the end results.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you want to destroy them?

speaker: HYBRID
line: No. What we want is the same thing that you want.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are these?

speaker: HYBRID
line: Human ova.

speaker: MULDER
line: Taken from whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: HYBRID
line: During her abduction, high application radiation procedure which caused superovulation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: HYBRID
line: For fertilization. They constitute one half of the necessary raw materials.

speaker: MULDER
line: For genetic hybridization, or reproduction. These women, these women are your birth mothers.

speaker: HYBRID
line: Barren now, from the same procedure that caused their cancer. And now they're left to die, their conditions hastened by the men running this project.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're trying to save them.

speaker: HYBRID
line: They're our mothers.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Mulder are you there?

speaker: MULDER
line: Langly I can't hear you.

speaker: LANGLY
line: We've got a security breach in section J14.

speaker: MULDER
line: You sure it's not Byers?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Nope I've got Byers right here on the screen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Langley help me out here, I don't know where I'm going.

speaker: LANGLY
line: You're in the bioquarenteen wing leading to an exit. At the end of the hall you'll access a door to a biosecure room. Working on the locks now.

speaker: MULDER
line: 'K Langly, Frohike I'm here open the door.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The doors work on redundant systems, we're working fast.

speaker: MULDER
line: Work faster. Langly open the door now! Get me outta here! Get me outta here now!

speaker: LANGLY
line: Almost there...go!

speaker: MULDER
line: Nurse, nurse! Dana Scully is supposed to be in her room, where is she?

speaker: NURSE
line: She's not there?

speaker: MULDER
line: No what happened to her?

speaker: NURSE
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well who the hell does know?

speaker: BYERS
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened to Scully?

speaker: BYERS
line: I got to her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is she now?

speaker: PENNY
line: Dr. Scanlon isn't coming back?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I don't think so Penny.

speaker: PENNY
line: Dana, I want you to get well. You've been such a comfort. You've got to be the one. You can't give up hope.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I haven't. I won't

speaker: MULDER
line: She gone?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry. I know what she meant to you. When I came to find you, you weren't in your room I got scared that something had happened..and I read some of what you wrote.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn't want you to read that. I had decided to throw it out. I decided tonight that um..that I'm not going to let this thing beat me. I came into this hospital able to work, and that's how I'm leaving.

speaker: MULDER
line: Byers tell you about Dr. Scanlon?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: He may very well have killed those women.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That will have to be proven, if we find him.

speaker: MULDER
line: When we find him. Scully something was done to you, something that you're just beginning to remember. You can't quite figure it out but it can be explained and it will be explained. And no matter what you think as a scientist or a doctor, there is a way, and you will find it, to save yourself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder I can't kid myself. People live with cancer. They carry on, and so will I. You know I've got things to finish, to prove to myself, to my family, but for my own reasons.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on back. The truth will save you Scully. I think it'll save both of us.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Skinner.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was leaving you a voice mail. It's 5:30 what are y..

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm working. How can I help you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want you to know that Scully's doing ok. She says she's coming back to work actually.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Good, that's good to hear.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was calling to thank you for your advice about your chainsmoking friend. I think you were right. We have to know what he knows, we just have to find another way.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's always another way.

speaker: CANCER MAN
line: Yes I believe there is, if you're willing to pay the price.
